C√°c b∆∞·ªõc Th·ª±c hi·ªán 1. T·∫°o Script T·ªïng h·ª£p K·∫øt qu·∫£ T·∫°o script t·ªïng h·ª£p PowerShell: # aggregate-results.ps1 param( [string]$ResultsPath = "test-results" ) $totalTests = 0 $passedTests = 0 $failedTests = 0 $skippedTests = 0 Get-ChildItem -Path $ResultsPath -Filter "*.trx" | ForEach-Object { $xml = [xml](Get-Content $_.FullName) $counters = $xml.TestRun.ResultSummary.Counters $totalTests += [int]$counters.total $passedTests += [int]$counters.passed $failedTests += [int]$counters.failed $skippedTests += [int]$counters.skipped } $results = @{ Total = $totalTests Passed = $passedTests Failed = $failedTests Skipped = $skippedTests PassRate = [math]::Round(($passedTests / $totalTests) * 100, 2) } ConvertTo-Json $results > "test-results/summary.json" 2. C·∫•u h√¨nh Thu th·∫≠p K·∫øt qu·∫£ C·∫≠p nh·∫≠t buildspec.yml cho thu th·∫≠p k·∫øt qu·∫£: version: 0.2 phases: post_build: commands: - mkdir -p combined-results - cp */test-results/*.trx combined-results/ - pwsh ./aggregate-results.ps1 -ResultsPath combined-results reports: test-reports: files: - "**/*.trx" file-format: VisualStudioTrx base-directory: combined-results artifacts: files: - combined-results/**/* - combined-results/summary.json name: test-results-$(date +%Y-%m-%d) 3. T·∫°o Tr√¨nh T·∫°o B√°o c√°o HTML T·∫°o m·∫´u b√°o c√°o: <!-- report-template.html --> <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> <title>T·ªïng k·∫øt Th·ª±c thi Ki·ªÉm th·ª≠</title> <style> .summary { margin: 20px; } .passed { color: green; } .failed { color: red; } .chart { width: 600px; height: 400px; } </style> </head> <body> <div class="summary"> <h2>T·ªïng k·∫øt Th·ª±c thi Ki·ªÉm th·ª≠</h2> <p>T·ªïng s·ªë Ki·ªÉm th·ª≠: {{totalTests}}</p> <p class="passed">ƒê√£ Pass: {{passedTests}}</p> <p class="failed">Th·∫•t b·∫°i: {{failedTests}}</p> <p>T·ª∑ l·ªá Pass: {{passRate}}%</p> </div> <div class="chart"> <canvas id="resultsChart"></canvas> </div> </body> </html> T·∫°o script t·∫°o b√°o c√°o: # generate-report.py import json import jinja2 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt def generate_report(summary_file, template_file, output_file): with open(summary_file) as f: data = json.load(f) # T·∫°o bi·ªÉu ƒë·ªì tr√≤n plt.figure(figsize=(8, 8)) plt.pie([data['Passed'], data['Failed'], data['Skipped']], labels=['ƒê√£ Pass', 'Th·∫•t b·∫°i', 'B·ªè qua'], colors=['green', 'red', 'gray']) plt.savefig('test-results/chart.png') # T·∫°o b√°o c√°o HTML with open(template_file) as f: template = jinja2.Template(f.read()) html = template.render( totalTests=data['Total'], passedTests=data['Passed'], failedTests=data['Failed'], passRate=data['PassRate'] ) with open(output_file, 'w') as f: f.write(html) 4. T·∫£i K·∫øt qu·∫£ l√™n S3 T·∫°o script t·∫£i l√™n: #!/bin/bash # upload-results.sh BUCKET_NAME="test-results-bucket" DATE=$(date +%Y-%m-%d) # T·∫£i l√™n k·∫øt qu·∫£ ki·ªÉm th·ª≠ aws s3 cp combined-results s3://$BUCKET_NAME/$DATE/ --recursive # T·∫£i l√™n b√°o c√°o t·ªïng k·∫øt aws s3 cp test-results/report.html \ s3://$BUCKET_NAME/$DATE/report.html \ --content-type "text/html" Ph√¢n t√≠ch K·∫øt qu·∫£ T·∫°o script ph√¢n t√≠ch: # analyze-results.py import pandas as pd import numpy as np def analyze_test_results(results_dir): # ƒê·ªçc t·∫•t c·∫£ file TRX dfs = [] for trx_file in glob.glob(f"{results_dir}/*.trx"): df = pd.read_xml(trx_file) dfs.append(df) # K·∫øt h·ª£p k·∫øt qu·∫£ combined_df = pd.concat(dfs) # T√≠nh to√°n th·ªëng k√™ stats = { 'total_duration': combined_df['duration'].sum(), 'avg_duration': combined_df['duration'].mean(), 'success_rate': (combined_df['outcome'] == 'Passed').mean() * 100, 'failure_patterns': combined_df[combined_df['outcome'] == 'Failed']['message'].value_counts() } return stats C√°c Th·ª±c h√†nh T·ªët nh·∫•t L∆∞u tr·ªØ K·∫øt qu·∫£
S·ª≠ d·ª•ng quy ∆∞·ªõc ƒë·∫∑t t√™n nh·∫•t qu√°n Tri·ªÉn khai ch√≠nh s√°ch l∆∞u gi·ªØ Sao l∆∞u k·∫øt qu·∫£ quan tr·ªçng T·∫°o B√°o c√°o
Bao g·ªìm c√°c ch·ªâ s·ªë li√™n quan T·∫°o bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn tr·ª±c quan Cung c·∫•p th√¥ng tin l·ªói chi ti·∫øt Ph√¢n t√≠ch D·ªØ li·ªáu
Theo d√µi xu h∆∞·ªõng theo th·ªùi gian X√°c ƒë·ªãnh m·∫´u l·ªói ph·ªï bi·∫øn Gi√°m s√°t ch·ªâ s·ªë hi·ªáu nƒÉng B∆∞·ªõc ti·∫øp theo Sau khi tri·ªÉn khai t·ªïng h·ª£p k·∫øt qu·∫£, ti·∫øp t·ª•c v·ªõi So s√°nh T·ªëc ƒë·ªô ƒë·ªÉ ph√¢n t√≠ch c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu nƒÉng t·ª´ th·ª±c thi song song.

C√°c b∆∞·ªõc Th·ª±c hi·ªán 1. C·∫•u h√¨nh Xu·∫•t K·∫øt qu·∫£ T·∫°o script xu·∫•t k·∫øt qu·∫£: // export-results.js const fs = require('fs'); const AWS = require('aws-sdk'); const cloudwatch = new AWS.CloudWatch(); const s3 = new AWS.S3(); async function exportResults(testResults, options) { const timestamp = new Date().toISOString(); const metrics = []; // ƒê·ªãnh d·∫°ng ch·ªâ s·ªë cho CloudWatch Object.entries(testResults.metrics).forEach(([key, value]) => { metrics.push({ MetricName: key, Value: value, Unit: 'None', Timestamp: timestamp, Dimensions: [ { Name: 'LoaiTest', Value: options.testType } ] }); }); // G·ª≠i ch·ªâ s·ªë ƒë·∫øn CloudWatch await cloudwatch.putMetricData({ Namespace: 'KiemThuHieuNang', MetricData: metrics }).promise(); // L∆∞u k·∫øt qu·∫£ chi ti·∫øt v√†o S3 await s3.putObject({ Bucket: options.resultsBucket, Key: `${options.testType}/${timestamp}.json`, Body: JSON.stringify(testResults), ContentType: 'application/json' }).promise(); } module.exports = { exportResults }; 2.
